node.title: Infratil and NZ Super Fund review ownership of RetireAustralia
node.description: Infrastructure investor Infratil and NZ Super Fund are reviewing their ownership of retirement village operator RetireAustralia.

node.title: Scott Watson appeal: Lawyers argue over what will be heard in court
node.description: A hearing to decide what will be heard in Scott Watson's latest fight against his 1999 convictions for murdering Olivia Hope and Ben Smart has wrapped up in the Court of Appeal.

node.title: Ukraine-Russia conflict: What are the nuclear risks?
node.description: Russia's nuclear forces are on "special alert" - what does that mean and how worried should we be?

node.title: Mosque terrorist attacks: Survivor begins 350km walk to reclaim peace
node.description: A survivor of the mosque shootings has left Dunedin's Octagon to begin his 350 kilometre walk to Christchurch to reclaim the terrorist's path in the name of peace.

node.title: New Zealand signs free trade deal with UK to eliminate all tariffs for NZ exports
node.description: New Zealand has overnight signed a historic free-trade agreement with the United Kingdom, sealing a deal agreed in principle last year. Audio

node.title: Some impacts of global warming 'irreversible' - UN
node.description: The authors of the new report say that there is still a brief window of time to avoid the very worst.

node.title: Dame Valerie Adams announces retirement
node.description: Two-time Olympic shot put champion Dame Valerie Adams has confirmed her retirement from international competition.

node.title: Hapū collective making progress with council over land return
node.description: Gisborne District Council is one step closer to returning land at Tokomaru Bay to its rightful owner, having issued a letter of intent.

node.title: Fatality prompts Coroner to recommend review of skateboard injuries
node.description: Coroner Tania Tetitaha wants the Ministry of Transport to consider law changes regarding the wearing of helmets while skateboarding.

node.title: No freedom yet for Covid-19 'bunker babies'
node.description: They are known as "bunker babies" - children born during the pandemic who have spent their short lives in and out of lockdown.

node.title: 4 dead after father fatally shoots 3 children inside Sacramento church: Police
node.description: The suspect, whose name has not been released, died by suicide after shooting the four people, officials said.

node.title: Sanctions will drive rethink on dealing with Russia - trade lawyer
node.description: Companies who do business with Russia are struggling due to sanctions imposed on the country by nations around the world.

node.title: Black Caps rely on Conway to help save test
node.description: Black Caps batters falter in world record chase against South Africa on penultimate day of second test.

node.title: Ukraine conflict: Nigeria condemns treatment of Africans
node.description: Nigeria's government has condemned reports that its citizens, and those of other African countries, have been stopped from leaving war-torn Ukraine.

node.title: House advances legislation to award WWII battalion the Congressional Gold Medal
node.description: The members of the 6888th Central Postal Directory Battalion with the motto "No Mail, Low Morale" made sure troops on the frontlines got their mail.

node.title: Labour endorses Efeso Collins for Auckland mayoralty
node.description: The Labour Party has announced it is endorsing Efeso Collins' independent campaign for the mayoralty of Auckland.

node.title: 'Glaring omission' corrected with extra funds for Marlborough Heritage Trust
node.description: The $170,000 of extra funding will help ease the pressure on the trust due to insurance hikes and the effects of Covid-19, say district councillors.

node.title: Dame Valerie Adams 'hanging up these size 14 throwing shoes'
node.description: The two-time Olympic shot put champion has announced her retirement after a 22-year career in the sport.

node.title: Photos: Inside the Russian invasion of Ukraine
node.description: Ukrainians are resisting Russia's attack, fighting with heavy ammo, homemade weapons and grit.

node.title: Sir David Skegg: 'I expect tourists will be welcome to NZ earlier than we expected'
node.description: The epidemiologist says more border restrictions may ease soon, as the National Party calls for all visitors to be allowed into the country. Audio

node.title: Ampol scraps share float option of Gull
node.description: Australian fuel company Ampol has scrapped the option of a share float of cut price fuel retailer Gull Petroluem to answer concerns it could still wield influence over the company as it moves to…

node.title: More Abbott baby formula recalled after reports of illnesses
node.description: Parents are encouraged to check their formula.

node.title: Virginia mothers have mixed reaction to rollback of mask mandates in schools
node.description: CBS News spoke to four mothers in Virginia about the difficulties they've faced during the pandemic.

node.title: States ban Russian liquor, divest pension funds over Ukraine invasion
node.description: Officials in at least nine states have directed Russian-sourced alcohol to be removed from store shelves. Others ended "sister state" relationships or moved to divest public money from Russian state entities.

node.title: U.S.-Russian space station cooperation continues despite crisis
node.description: Despite the Ukraine crisis, U.S. and Russian space station engineers continue working together.

node.title: New Jersey boy surfs for more than 600 days straight to raise money for charity
node.description: Carter Doorley said his goal is to surf 1,000 days in a row.

node.title: Covid-19 vaccine Novavax approved for use in New Zealand
node.description: The Novavax Covid-19 vaccine has been approved in New Zealand for those aged 18 and over.

node.title: Buttigieg says Biden "will continue to fight for" social policies
node.description: The transportation secretary said the president will "speak to" economic issues in the State of the Union address.

node.title: KiwiSaver members warned to stay steady as balances hit by volatility
node.description: KiwiSaver members are being reminded not to lose their heads as their balances are hit by volatility caused by Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: Vista Group's losses improve by 83 percent, to $9.9m
node.description: Cinema software company Vista Group has trimmed its losses as moviegoer attendance recovered globally.
